paragraph.paragraph: EiffelEnvision project's file system is built from enumerating the contents of a ../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlcluster location. The enumeration process finds and adds all located Eiffel source files (*.e) and adds them to a project based on their discovered location. No other files are added to the project unless they have been explicitly added at some point in the project's life. For more information, see ../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folders.

To add existing file(s), select a folder in your EiffelEnvision project. Now select Project, Add Existing File... (SHIFT+ALT+A). Alternatively select the Add, Add Existing File... from the folder context menu. Once selected a file browser dialog will be displayed. Locate and select the file you would like to add to the project and click Ok. Cancel will close the file dialog and no file will be added to the project.
If the ../../structure/project.xmlProject Folder is selected when adding an existing file, the file will be added under the ../../structure/project_items/project_items.xmlProject Items section of your project, because they share the same ../project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlpathPath. Adding existing non-Eiffel source files (*.e) may only be done using the ../../structure/project_items/project_items.xmlProject Items Folder and it's subfolders and ../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclusters, as well the ../../structure/other_project_items/other_project_items.xmlOther Project Items Folder and its subfolders. Any existing Eiffel source file may be added to any one of the folders in an EiffelEnvision project. For more information on this restriction, see ../../structure/project_items/project_items.xmlProject Items Folder.

Because EiffelEnvision ../../structure/project.xmlProjects directly reflect an underlying file system, adding existing files to folders whose ../project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlpathPath is not the same as the location of the file being added to the project will result in the added file being copied to the folder ../project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlpathPath and then added. This is exactly how other Visual Studio .NET languages that ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconFolder-BasedReference-BasedProjects.htmmanage project using files act.

For the ../../structure/other_project_items/other_project_items.xmlOther Project Items Folder and it's subfolders, existing files that are added will not be copied. This is because ../../structure/other_project_items/other_project_items.xmlOther Project Itemsms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconFolder-BasedReference-BasedProjects.htm link to files and does not have a direct representation of them, base on the underlying file system.
